newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada dollar ends firmer in quiet holiday trading.
newsitem.headline: Canada dollar ends firmer in quiet holiday trading.

text.p: * The Canadian dollar firmed to C$1.3463 (US$0.7427) by the close of trading on Thursday from midday levels around C$1.3470 and this morning's open at C$1.3494 (US$0.7410) in sluggish closing trade, dealers said.
* They said the unit firmed on a short round of buying interest this morning, but trading slowed in the afternoon.
"I'm still looking for the Canadian dollar to strengthen on corporate interest from Canadian exporters," one currency dealer said.
A Reuter survey of Canadian economists forecast Canada's gross domestic product would rise 0.3 percent on a monthly basis in October and 0.7 percent in the third quarter.
On the crosses, the Canadian dollar rose to 1.1379 marks from Wednesday's close of 1.1322 marks and edged up to 84.39 yen from 83.98 yen.
